name: QtMEL
body:
### Welcome to the QtMEL project website. **QtMEL** is a [Qt](http://qt-project.org/) library that wraps [Libav](http://libav.org/), [OpenCV](http://opencv.org/) and [RtAudio](http://www.music.mcgill.ca/~gary/rtaudio/) libraries and allows you easily grab your desktop screen, your cameras, your audio input devices and finally encode audio/video streams. ### Project description **Platform:** currently only Windows (Linux version is partially done)
**License:** LGPL
**Current version:** 1.0 Alpha
**Issue tracker:** [Here](https://github.com/kibsoft/QtMEL/issues) ### Key features * desktop screen capture with variable frame rate * web-cameras capture with variable frame rate * changing the image source on the fly (screen<->camera) while recording a video * audio input devices capture * video encoding with variable and fixed frame rate * audio encoding ### Dependencies to build the project 1. **Libav** - [Here](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/77719957/QtMEL_FFmpeg.zip) is a [git-14d94a1](http://ffmpeg.zeranoe.com/builds/source/ffmpeg/ffmpeg-git-14d94a1.tar.bz2) version (**QtMEL** is tested only with this version). It contains _inlude_ and _lib_ folders. 2. **OpenCV** - Download [here](http://sourceforge.net/projects/opencvlibrary/files/opencv-win/2.4.5/OpenCV-2.4.5.exe/download). 3. **QtMultimediaKit** - Download [here](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/77719957/QtMultimediaKit.zip). There are includes and dlls that were build using Qt 4.7.4/MinGW. 4. **RtAudio** - you don't need to download anything it is in **QtMEL**. ### Ready to use builds Just download [this](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/77719957/QtMEL_Library.zip) archive and you will be able to use the **QtMEL** library in your projects! All you need is to modify your .pro file like this:
``` #add QtMEL library INCLUDEPATH += QTMEL_INCLUDE_PATH //just replace this with the actual path LIBS += -LQTMEL_LIB_PATH //just replace this with the actual path CONFIG(debug, debug|release) { LIBS += -lqtmeld1 } else { LIBS += -lqtmel1 } ``` Then you must to include the headers this way: ``` #include #include #include #include ... ``` Happy coding! ### Examples In order to understand how to use the classes provided by **QtMEL** you can look at the [examples](https://github.com/kibsoft/QtMEL/tree/master/examples) folder in sources. 1. **EncoderExample** - it is the first example that allows you to capture your desktop screen(or parts of it) and record the streams(video/audio) to a file. Also this example contains the code that generates 500 frames and then encodes them to a video using fixed frame rate. 2. **CameraExample** - this example allows you to capture your web-cameras (with audio). You can download these examples [here](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/77719957/QtMEL_Examples.zip)(compiled). ### Thanks I want to thank **Daniel Roggen** for his [QtFFmpegWrapper](https://code.google.com/p/qtffmpegwrapper/)! It became the starting point for my **QtMEL** project.
